column5: I tried retirement again for about the XXXX time and I just can't do it. Retirement is for old (or rich people). Well, the old part I might be getting close to LOL. Anyway I happened to stumble across a job posting for a Purchasing Agent for a company located just 7 minutes down the road from my house.  Well, I decided to submit my resume not really expecting to hear from them but what the heck. They needed someone with a background in electronics, purchasing, and inventory control and I had all of those. Well, three interviews later and they offered me the job and guess who the new purchasing agent is for Carma Industries Inc. is?  Now, I have already got some quotes on some parts I need from OFC members (and I'll be working on those in the next few days) but I am going to be looking for some contacts in the electronic component supply business, circuit board manufacturing, and a variety of other related businesses.  Yes, we do have suppliers for everything we need but I will be giving first choice to OFC members. Quality, dependibility, and price in that order.  If you feel that we might be able to do business then please email me ([email protected]) I will do my best to help you as long as you are doing your best to help us!  If I don't get back to you in a day or two, please don't panic, I have a huge task in front of me! BTW, anyone on here really good with FoxPro?  Cliff  Oh, and I promise, this is the last time I'll retire!
Way to go Cliff    Nothing like keepin on keepin on to stay youngish..I doubt ill ever retire either..
Hope you can still fish when you want to fish .........lol
One of these days you're gonna be my boss Cliff. I just know it. Congrats on your most recent adventure. You'll do good.
Congratulations Cliff!! Does this mean we are losing our small engines mechanic?
I knew in the back of my mind, that you would get fed up with retirement Good for you my friend, nothing keeps you young like job well done.

Don't ever stop Cliff.  I don't know you personally, but you sound like the type of guy who can't stop, thus you shouldn't.  You know why..  Once you force yourself to stop, other things start stopping too.  Things that shouldn't stop.  Things you need to live.  Seen it happen to a lot of people.
Just make sure you get them to take a few extra dollars out of your pay to cover the increase in income taxes you will have to pay...Them infernal revenoors will want their share...

I haven't known you for long Cliff, but I'm a pretty good judge of character; Carma is lucky to have you.  Remember the old adage...  if you need something done, give it to a busy person.   Here's to many more years of you being busy.
Good luck in your new venture Cliff!  are you sure that email address is correct?  G
It looks like one of those slippery U's has escaped. I'll bet it is [email protected]
Thanks guys for all your support and help and yes, you are right, one glass of wine too many and I missed the "u" LOL. I know I can always count on the support from you guys!
Cliff...good luck in your new career!!  You work incredibly hard and are very dedicated to whatever it is you set your mind too.  I'm sure you will be successful!!
There's a company that just got lucky! Congrats Cliff  HH
Have at 'er!! My old boss is still working a reduced workweek at 40hrs per. He just turned 80 last month. Good luck to you.
Cliff, nobody here has caught on yet, but every time you mention retirement, you mean changing a tire.  They are lucky to have you.
And just think how much closer you are to the Tim Horton's on hwy 36...
Good for you Cliff.......you're only as old as you feel....like the old saying goes "How old would you be if you didn't know how old you were" ...
good job buddy! hope to see ya soon
